metadata.title: Ahsan Iqbal urges officers to play role in export-led growth

content.article_body: LAHORE, Jun 30 (APP):Federal Minister for Planning, Development and Special Initiatives Prof Ahsan Iqbal on Monday urged the officers to play a leading role in enabling export-led growth, digitisingA government operations, building climate resilience, improving infrastructure deliveryA and ensuring inclusive development. He said this while inaugurating a modern classroom at the Pakistan Administrative Staff CollegeA (PASC), National School of Public Policy (NSPP) Lahore, and commenced the 123rd NationalA Management Course (NMC). Addressing the participants, the minister said the civil servants must play their vitalA role for Pakistanas transformation, adding that the system must be reformed to deliver betterA outcomes. He introduced the STAR model a Stable, Transparent, Agile andA Responsible a as a governance framework to guide civil service transformation. Prof Ahsan Iqbal presented a comprehensive roadmap for governance reforms and institutionalA performance improvement, emphasising the transition from a procedure-focused toA a mission-driven bureaucracy. The minister said the country is facing a crucial moment requiring data-driven, technology-enabledA and accountable governance. Ahsan said: aWe must build institutions that are policy-consistent and shielded from political volatility,A ensure transparency in decision-making, foster agility to respond to changing demands andA instill responsibility in the use of public resources.a The minister commended the role of civil servants to make the China-Pakistan Economic CorridorA (CPEC) a success which showed the dedication of Pakistanas civil servants, adding that civil servantsA of various ministries worked with dedication, commitment and unity, and they made theA CPEC successful in all stages. Prof Ahsan Iqbal outlined the governmentas long-term economic vision under the bannerA of aURAAN Pakistana, which aims at making Pakistan a $1 trillion economy by 2035. He saidA the strategy is built on the five pillars of the 5Es: Exports, E-Pakistan, Environment, Energy & InfrastructureA and Equity & Empowerment. Referring to Islamic teachings, he reminded the participants that public service is a responsibility andA leadership in Islam is a duty, not a privilege. The minister encouraged the course participants to take part in the training with a spirit ofA service, creativity and commitment to the national development.
